Title: Pupil Attainment
Description: Number of pupils who attained a given number of qualifications by level and stage.

Title: Alcohol Related Hospital Discharges
Description: Number and European Age-sex Standardised Rates (EASRs) of general acute inpatient and day case discharges with an alcohol-related diagnosis.

Title: Business - Births, Deaths and Survival Rates
Description: Number and rate (per 10,000 adults) of VAT/PAYE registrations, de-registrations and business survival rates

Title: Earnings
Description: Mean and median gross weekly earnings (£s) by gender, working pattern and workplace/residence measure.

Title: Economic Inactivity
Description: Economic inactivity level and rate by gender

Title: House Prices
Description: Value of residential property transactions

Title: Regional Gross Value Added (GVA)
Description: Regional Gross Value Added (GVA)  by local authority area by year

Title: Job Related Training
Description: Number, and percent, of people receiving job related training in the last 3 months.

Title: School Leaver Destinations - Follow Up
Description: Number, and percent, of school leavers by destination from follow up survey

Title: Natural Features (National Indicator)
Description: Percent of natural features, on protected nature sites, in favourable condition

Title: National Performance Framework
Description: Data underlying the National Performance Framework Indicators. These give a measure of national wellbeing including a range of economic, social and environmental indicators.

Title: Road Vehicles
Description: Road vehicle numbers, household car ownership and fuel consumption

Title: Low Birthweight
Description: Number, and percent, of low birthweight (less than 2500g) babies (single births).

Title: Income Support Claimants
Description: Number of income support claimants by age and gender (age split not available for gender).

Title: Child Benefit - Children
Description: Geographical analysis of Child Benefit at small area levels. Number of children in a live Child Benefit award as at 31st August.

Title: Terrestrial Breeding Birds
Description: Index of abundance of terrestrial breeding birds (1994=100)

Title: Healthy Life Expectancy
Description: Years of Healthy Life Expectancy (including confidence intervals) by age, sex, deprivation, and urban rural classification

Title: Buildings at Risk Register
Description: Percent of A-listed buildings on the Buildings at Risk Register (BARR)

Title: Disability Living Allowance
Description: Number of Disability Living Allowance claimants by age group and gender.

Title: Recorded Crimes and Offences
Description: Number, and rate per 10,000 population, of crimes and offences recorded by the police

Title: Emergency Repeat Admissions
Description: Percent of people aged 65+ who are admitted as an emergency to hospitals at least twice within 12 months.

Title: Home Care Services
Description: Number of hours of home care provided by local authority, and number of clients receiving home care from LA and private/voluntary providers.

Title: Scottish Housing Quality Standard (SHQS)
Description: Indicators from the Scottish House Condition Survey (SHCS)

Title: Infant Deaths
Description: Number of infant deaths (stillbirth, perinatal and those aged under 1 year old).

Title: Home Care Clients
Description: Number and rate per 1,000 population of home care clients by age and gender.

Title: Standard Geography Code Register
Description: The geography Entities (levels such as Council Area - S12) and Instances (areas such as Glasgow City - S12000046)

Title: Looked After Children
Description: Information about the number of looked after children by type of care setting.

Title: Local Authority Housing Council Housing
Description: Number of lettings, evictions and abandonments of local authority housing.

Title: House Sales
Description: Number of house sales

Title: Annual Business Survey
Description: Financial and employment data by broad industry by year. Annual Business Survey (ABS) provides data mainly on the Production (including Manufacturing), Construction and Service Sectors in Scotland. The statistics are best suited to the analysis of individual industries rather than the economy as a whole.

Title: Measles Mumps Rubella (MMR) Immunisation
Description: Number, and percent of, children who were immunised against measles, mumps and rubella by 5 years of age

Title: Population Estimates - Census 2001
Description: Population from Census Day, 29 April 2001 (number of people).

Title: Business Demography - Births and Deaths
Description: Number and rate (per 10,000 adults) of VAT/PAYE registrations and de-registrations.

Title: Hospital Admissions
Description: Number of admissions to non-psychiatric/non-obstetric hospitals in Scotland.

Title: School Pupil Census
Description: Information from the School Pupil Census

Title: School Attendance Rate
Description: Attendance rate of pupils attending publicly funded schools

Title: Employment and Support Allowance
Description: Number of Employment and Support Allowance claimants by age, gender, and ethnicity.

Title: Community Orders
Description: Number of Social Work Orders given by type, age, gender, employment status and ethnicity.

Title: Social Work Orders Commenced
Description: Number of social work orders commenced in each local authority area from 2004-05 onwards, broken down by type of order

Title: Organisations
Description: A dataset with all of the organisations involved in creating and publishing statistics on this site.

Title: Business Site Counts
Description: Number of business sites by sector and employee size band by SIC 2007.

Title: Business Stocks and Sites
Description: Number and rate (per 10,000 adults) of VAT/PAYE registered stocks and sites operating in Scotland.

Title: Carbon Footprint
Description: Greenhouse gas emissions that are associated with the consumption by Scottish residents on goods and services and by private heating and motoring

Title: Primary 1 Children Body Mass Index - Clinical
Description: Percent of children who are classed as healthy weight, overweight, obese or severely obese at their Primary 1 review.

Title: Home Care Client Group
Description: Number of home care clients by care type or disability. Number and rate per 1,000 population of home care clients by disability/condition

Title: Care Homes: Occupancy Rate
Description: Occupancy rate in care homes, for different main client groups and across care sectors

Title: Deaths
Description: Numbers of deaths registered by cause.

Title: Travel to Work and Other Purposes
Description: Statistics on what mode of transport (walking, cycling, car, bus, train) people usually use to get to work and education, purposes of journeys made by Scottish people.

Title: Crime Clear up Rates
Description: Crimes cleared up by the police as a percentage of those recorded.

Title: Care Homes: Places
Description: The number and ratio (per 1000 adults) of registered places in care homes, for different main client groups and across care sectors

Title: Dwellings per Hectare
Description: Number of dwellings per hectare.

Title: Concessionary Travel Cards
Description: Number of concessionary cards issued to all adults, and adults aged over 60

Title: Criminal Justice Social Work Reports
Description: Number of criminal justice social work reports (CJSWRs) by various characteristics. These were formerly (prior to 2011) called Social Enquiry Reports.

Title: Travel times to key services by car or public transport
Description: Travel times (minutes) to key services by car or public transport

Title: Primary 1 BMI Distribution
Description: Number of P1 BMI Reviews. Clinical and Epidemiological category measurements are provided in separate datasets.

Title: Breached Order Applications
Description: Number of breaches applications for social work orders by order type.

Title: Community Payback Orders: Breach Applications
Description: Breach applications during the life of Community Payback Orders which were completed/terminated in each year from 2012-13, by gender.

Title: Cancer Registrations (1997 to 2009)
Description: Number of cancer registrations by type and gender.

Title: Greenhouse Gas Emissions
Description: This contains the results of the Scottish Greenhouse Gas Inventory, which is the key tool for understanding the origins and magnitudes of greenhouse emissions

Title: Derelict and Urban Vacant Land
Description: Area of Derelict and Urban Vacant Land (hectares)

Title: Primary 1 Children Body Mass Index - Epidemiological
Description: Percent of children who are classed as healthy weight, overweight, obese or severely obese at their Primary 1 review.

Title: Home Care Client Living Arrangements
Description: Number and rate per 1,000 population of home care clients by living arrangement

Title: Historical Population Estimates (pre-2001, historical geographic boundaries)
Description: Historical estimates by gender and age (pre-2001)

Title: Dependency Ratio
Description: The population of children (aged 0 to 15) and older people (aged 65 and over) expressed as a percentage of people aged 16 to 64

Title: Employment
Description: Employment level and rate by age and gender.

Title: Births
Description: Number of births by gender that were registered in a calendar year, or occurred in a mid-year period (1 July to 30 June).

Title: Economic Activity
Description: Economic activity level and rate by gender

Title: Pupil Attainment (English and Maths)
Description: Number of pupils who attained gained awards in English and Maths at SCQF Level 3 or above.

Title: Urban Rural Classification (6-Fold)
Description: Urban Rural Classification (6-Fold)

Title: Geographic Area - 2001 Census
Description: Geographic Area - 2001 Census

Title: Land Area (based on 2001 Data Zones)
Description: Land area in hectares based on aggregating 2001 Data Zone data.

Title: Population living in close proximity to a derelict site
Description: Percent of people living within 500 metres of a derelict site.

Title: Reconvictions
Description: Reconviction rates by offenders' gender and age

Title: Places in Care Homes with En-Suite Facilities
Description: Percentage of places in Care Homes which have ensuite facilities

Title: Pension Credits
Description: Number of Pension Credit claimants by age and gender.

Title: State Retirement Pension
Description: Number of State Pension claimants by age and gender.

Title: School Leaver Destinations Initial
Description: Number, and percent, of school leavers by destination from initial survey

Title: Breastfeeding
Description: Number, and percentage of, babies being breastfed or exclusively breastfed by review stage.

Title: Court Process Times
Description: Percentage of summary criminal cases dealt with within 26 weeks.

Title: Full-Time and Part-Time Employment
Description: Number and percentage of people in full time and part time employment (aged 16+)

Title: Intensive Home Care
Description: Percent of people aged 65+ with high levels of care needs who are cared for at home

Title: Municipal Waste
Description: Municipal Waste (tonnes) and arising per capita (kgs)

Title: Probation Orders By Length
Description: Number of probation orders commenced by length.

Title: DTP/Pol/Hib Immunisation
Description: Number, and percent, of children who have completed their primary immunisation course of the DTP/Pol/Hib vaccine by 24 months of age. Also known as the '5-in-1' vaccination.

Title: Working Age Claimants Of Key Benefits
Description: Number of working age claimants of key benefits by age

Title: Generation and Management of Household Waste
Description: Household waste presented by waste category and method of management

Title: Poverty
Description: The number and proportions of people living in private households with an equivalised income of less than 60% of the UK median before housing costs.

Title: Poverty (all people)
Description: Official Statistics of the number and proportions of people in poverty. Various poverty measures and breakdowns are available.

Title: Ante-Natal Smoking
Description: Number and percentage of mothers reporting their smoking status at ante-natal booking visit in the community or at hospital.

Title: Road Casualties
Description: Number of people killed and seriously injured on Scotland's roads by age and gender.

Title: Social Work Staffing
Description: Number, and WTE, of social work staff by gender

Title: Scottish Health Survey
Description: Indicators of population health and related risk factors from the Scottish Health Survey.

Title: Scottish Health Survey-Scotland level data
Description: Indicators of population health and related risk factors from the Scottish Health Survey (2008-2019).

Title: Incapacity Benefit and Severe Disablement Claimants
Description: Number of people claiming incapacity benefits and/or severe disablement allowance

Title: Unemployment Model Based Estimates
Description: Unemployment Model Based Estimates (level and rate)

Title: Places In Single Rooms In Care Homes
Description: Percentage of single room places in Care Homes by type of provision.

Title: Council House Sales
Description: Number of council house sales to sitting tenants by housing type.

Title: Care Homes: Number of Homes
Description: The number of care homes for different main client groups and across care sectors

Title: Supervised Attendance Orders By Length
Description: Number of supervised attendance orders commenced by length

Title: Never Worked
Description: Number, and percent, of people aged 16+ who have never had a paid or unpaid job

Title: Pupil Attainment (Additional Support Needs)
Description: Number of pupils with additional support needs (ASN) who attained a given number of qualifications by level and stage.

Title: Drug Related Hospital Discharge
Description: Number and European Age-sex Standardised Rates (EASRs) of general acute inpatient and day case stays with a drug-related diagnosis.

Title: Income And Poverty Modelled Estimates
Description: This dataset includes information about estimated household income, and percent of households with low incomes.

Title: Dwellings by Type
Description: Number of dwellings by type

Title: Outdoor Visits (National Indicator)
Description: Percent of adults making one or more visits to the outdoors per week

Title: Road Transport Expenditure
Description: Local and central government transport expenditure

Title: Job Seeker's Allowance Claimants
Description: Number, and percent, of people claiming Job Seeker's Allowance by gender and age.

Title: Dwellings by Council Tax Band
Description: Number of dwellings by Council Tax band, and percentage of dwellings in each Council Tax band.

Title: Dwellings by Number of Rooms
Description: Number of dwellings by number of rooms within the dwelling

Title: Public Transport
Description:
Number of bus passenger journeys and bus vehicle kilometres on all services, passenger train stations and satisfaction with public transport. 

Figures for the convenience of public transport are from the Scottish Household Survey (SHS).  Note that the public convenience data is no longer updated as the question was withdrawn from the survey.

Title: Attendance Allowance
Description: Number of people claiming Attendance Allowance by age, gender and rate of award

Title: Qualifications of working age adults
Description: Percent of people with a given highest qualification level.

Title: Disability Living Allowance (Care Component)
Description: Number of Disability Living Allowance claimants by lev of Care Component

Title: Fuel Poverty (Scottish House Condition Survey)
Description: Number of households in fuel poverty and extreme fuel poverty by selected dwelling and household characteristics.

Title: Child Dental Health
Description: Percentage of P1 children in Scotland with no obvious decay experience.

Title: Age of First Time Mothers
Description: Number and percentage of first time mothers who are aged 19 and under, or 35 and over.

Title: Renewable Electricity
Owner: Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy
Description: Electricity generated by renewables as a percentage of gross consumption

Title: Not in Employment, Education or Training (NEET)
Description: Number, and percent, of young people (16-19) who were not in education, employment or training.

Title: Household Estimates
Description: Number and percentage of total dwellings that are occupied, vacant, unoccupied and exempt from paying council tax, long-term empty, second homes, are occupied and exempt from paying council tax, and that are receiving Single Adult Council Tax discount.  An 'occupied dwelling' is roughly equivalent to a household.

Title: Energy Consumption
Owner: Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy
Description: Consumption (GWh) by energy type and energy customer type

Title: Road Network and Traffic
Description: Road network traffic, perceptions of congestion and road condition

Title: Number of HMO Licences in Force
Description: Number of House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) Licences in force at 31 March.

Title: End of Life Care
Description: The percentage of last 6 months of life spent at home or in a community setting

Title: Gender Pay Gap
Description: The difference between male and female median earnings (gross hourly earnings excluding overtime) as a percentage of male earnings.

Title: Dwellings In Flood Risk Areas
Description: Number of dwellings in flood risk areas

Title: Police Officer Quarterly Strength
Description: Number of Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) police officers in Scotland at the end of each respective quarter.

Title: Greenhouse Gas Emissions by Source Sector (Historical categories)
Description: This contains the results of the Scottish Greenhouse Gas Inventory, which is the key tool for understanding the origins and magnitudes of greenhouse emissions.  This presentation uses the sectoral classifications used in the main publication prior to the June 2020 publication.

Title: Carbon Footprint Breakdown
Description: Greenhouse gas emissions that are associated with the consumption by Scottish residents on goods and services and by private heating and motoring

Title: Mental Wellbeing - Scottish Surveys Core Questions
Description: Mental wellbeing by tenure, household type, age, sex and disability. The Scottish Survey Core Questions is an innovative project drawing together multiple household surveys to provide a large sample for subnational analysis.

Title: Unpaid Care Provision - Scottish Surveys Core Questions
Description: Unpaid care provision by tenure, household type, age, sex and disability. The Scottish Survey Core Questions is an innovative project drawing together multiple household surveys to provide a large sample for subnational analysis.

Title: General Health - Scottish Surveys Core Questions
Description: Self-assessed general health by tenure, household type, age, sex and disability. The Scottish Survey Core Questions is an innovative project drawing together multiple household surveys to provide a large sample for subnational analysis.

Title: Smoking - Scottish Survey Core Questions
Description: Current smokers by Current smokers by tenure, household type, age, sex and disability. The Scottish Survey Core Questions is an innovative project drawing together multiple household surveys to provide a large sample for subnational analysis.

Title: Disability - Scottish Surveys Core Questions
Description:
Percentage of adults reporting a limiting long term physical or mental health problem, by age, gender, household type, and type of housing tenure.
The Scottish Survey Core Questions is an innovative project drawing together multiple household surveys to provide a large sample for subnational analysis.

Title: Confidence in Policing - Scottish Survey Core Questions
Description: Confidence across six policing functions by tenure, household type, sex and disability. The Scottish Survey Core Questions is an innovative project drawing together multiple household surveys to provide a large sample for subnational analysis.

Title: Perceptions of Local Crime - Scottish Surveys Core Questions
Description: Perceptions of the local crime rate by tenure, household type, sex and disability. The Scottish Survey Core Questions is an innovative project drawing together multiple household surveys to provide a large sample for subnational analysis.

Title: Debt Arrangement Scheme (DAS)
Description: The number of Debt Arrangement Scheme (DAS) Debt Payment Programmes approved. DAS is a statutory debt management solution administered by Accountant in Bankruptcy (AiB)

Title: Personal Insolvency
Description: Personal insolvencies in Scotland (awards of bankruptcy and Protected Trust Deeds).

Title: Corporate Insolvency
Description: Scottish registered companies becoming insolvent or entering receivership.

Title: Alcohol use ever among young people (SALSUS)
Description: The percentage of 13 and 15 year olds who have ever drunk alcohol.

Title: Drug use behaviour among young people (SALSUS)
Description: Drug use among 13 and 15 year olds in Scotland.

Title: Drinking behaviour among young people (SALSUS)
Description: When 13 and 15 year olds last had an alcoholic drink.

Title: Smoking prevalence in young people (SALSUS)
Description: Smoking prevalence among 13 and 15 year olds in Scotland.

Title: New Build Housing Starts and Completions
Description: Quarterly time series data on Scottish approvals, starts and completions by sector

Title: Dwellings Median Number Of Rooms
Description: The median number of rooms in dwellings for data zones, council areas and Scotland.

Title: Scottish Index of Multiple Deprivation - Crime Indicators
Description: The most recent Scottish Index of Multiple Deprivation (SIMD) was published in January 2020. This dataset contains the indicators that were used to calculate SIMD 2016 and SIMD 2020 crime domains.

Title: Land Area (based on 2011 Data Zones)
Description: Land area in hectares based on aggregating 2011 Data Zone data.

Title: Affordable Housing Supply Programme
Description: Quarterly Scotland figures for the Affordable Housing Supply Programme approvals, starts and completions, split by category, form of housing supply, and type of housing supply from 2000-01 to the latest quarter.

Title: Scottish Index of Multiple Deprivation - Geographic Access to Services Indicators
Description: Mean travel time (in minutes) to key services, by car or public transport. This dataset contains indicators  used to calculate the geographic access to services domains of SIMD 2016 and SIMD 2020.

Title: Scottish Index of Multiple Deprivation - Employment Indicators
Description: The number and percentage of people who are employment deprived

Title: Scottish Index of Multiple Deprivation - Income Indicators
Description: The number and percentage of people claiming relevant benefits. This dataset contains the indicators that were used to calculate the income domain of the 2016 Scottish Index of Multiple Deprivation.

Title: Children in Low Income Families
Description: The number and percentage of children living in families in receipt of Child Tax Credit (CTC) whose reported income is less than 60 per cent of the median income or in receipt of Income Support (IS) or Income-Based Jobseekers Allowance (JSA).

Title: Population Estimates (Current Geographic Boundaries)
Description: Mid-year population estimates. Higher geographies are aggregated from 2011 Data Zones.

Title: Population Estimates Summary (Current Geographic Boundaries)
Description: Mid-year population estimates. Higher geographies are aggregated from 2011 Data Zones.

Title: Social Work Orders Terminated
Description: Number of social work orders completed/terminated in each local authority area from 2004-05 onwards, broken down by type of order and whether successfully completed.

Title: Number of General Practices with Registered Patients
Description: Data indicates the number of general practices (GP surgeries) by area as at 1 October for each year presented.

Title: Headcount of General Practice Workforce
Description: Data indicates headcount of GP workforce by Health Board and Local Authority as at 30 September for each year presented.

Title: General Practice List Size
Description: Data indicates patients registered with practices by Health Board and Local Authority as at 1 October for each year presented.

Title: New clients presenting at specialist drug treatment services (SDMD)
Description: Individuals presenting for initial assessment (for new drug treatment episode) at specialist drug treatment services, and for whom a SMR25a form was submitted to Scottish Drug Misuse Database (SDMD). Selected breakdowns by age, gender, illicit drug, prescribed drug and whether or not client injects.

Title: Scottish Welfare Fund Expenditure
Description: Expenditure for awards paid out for the Scottish Welfare Fund

Title: Scottish Welfare Fund Applications
Description: Number of applications received for Community Care Grants and Crisis Grants for the Scottish Welfare Fund

Title: Population Estimates (Historical Geographic Boundaries)
Description: Mid-year population estimates. Higher geographies are aggregated from 2001 Data Zones.

Title: Delayed Discharges - Monthly Census
Description: Number of delays by length of delay and reason for delay at the monthly census point.

Title: Household Tenure - Scottish Survey Core Questions
Description: The way in which the household occupies their accomodation. The Scottish Survey Core Questions is an innovative project drawing together multiple household surveys to provide a large sample for subnational analysis.

Title: Local Level Average Household Income Estimates 2014
Description: Mean and median gross household income estimates at Data Zone level for 2014

Title: Local Level Distribution of Household Income Estimates 2014
Description: Gross household income distribution estimates at Data Zone level for 2014

Title: Smoking behaviour and self-rated health (SALSUS)
Description: Self-assessed general health by smoking status, age, and gender

Title: Drug use behaviour and deprivation (SALSUS)
Description: Deprivation by drug use behaviour, age, and gender

Title: Drinking behaviour and emotional and behavioural problems (SALSUS)
Description: Emotional and behavioural problems, by drinking behaviour, age, and gender

Title: Mid-Year Household Estimates
Description: The number of households in each council area and in Scotland

Title: Average Household Size
Description: The average number of people per household in each council area and in Scotland

Title: Household Type
Description: The number of households of different types in Scotland (i.e. 2 adult household)

Title: Crime Victimisation Rate (National Indicator)
Description: Proportion of people in Scotland who have been the victim of one or more crimes in the past year

Title: Local Crime Rate (National Indicator)
Description: Percent of respondents who believe that crime has stayed the same or reduced in the past 2 years in their local area

Title: Perception of Neighbourhood (National Indicator)
Description: Percent of people who rate their neighbourhood as a very good place to live

Title: Neighbourhood rating - Scottish Household Survey
Description: How adults in Scotland rate their local neighbourhood as a place to live, from the Scottish Household Survey (SHS)

Title: Council Tax Collection Rates
Description: Data on Council Tax amounts billed and collected, up to the end of the most recent complete billing year

Title: Regional Domestic Tourism
Description: Domestic tourism statistics by region and year. All figures come from the Great Britain Tourism Survey (GBTS) and represent 3-year annual averages due to small sample sizes on regional level.

Title: Smoking prevalence and deprivation (SALSUS)
Description: Deprivation by smoking behaviour, age and gender

Title: Gross Domestic Product: Annual Output by Industry
Description: The value of goods and services produced annually, reported as an index (chainlinked volume measure)

Title: Gross Domestic Product: Quarterly Output by Industry
Description: The value of goods and services produced quarterly

Title: Tourism Day Visits - Activities
Description: The Great Britain Day Visits Survey measures the visits and expenditure of tourism day visitors to Scotland.

Title: Scottish Accommodation Occupancy
Description: The Scottish Accommodation Occupancy Survey (SAOS) gathers and analyses data on occupancy levels in hotels, guest houses, B&Bs, self-catering, hostels and caravan & camping parks.

Title: Tourism Day Visits - Demographics
Description: The Great Britain Day Visits Survey measures the visits and expenditure of tourism day visitors to Scotland.

Title: Tourism Day Visits - Location
Description: The Great Britain Day Visits Survey measures the visits and expenditure of tourism day visitors to Scotland.

Title: Tourism Day Visits - Transport
Description: The Great Britain Day Visits Survey measures the visits and expenditure of tourism day visitors to Scotland.

Title: Temporary Accommodation Statistics
Description: These figures show a snapshot figure of the number of households in Temporary Accommodation per local authority at 31st March each year.

Title: Fire - Type of Incident
Description: Number of fires, by type of fire and whether accidental or not

Title: Bus Accessibility
Description: The indicator gives a score for the availability and frequency of bus service in each data zone.

Title: Homelessness Applications
Description: Summary figures of 1) all homelessness applications to local authorities each financial year in Scotland, 2) the total number of these assessed as homeless or threatened with homelessness.

Title: Housing Lists
Description: Total number of applications on waiting lists and transfer lists for a local authority dwelling

Title: Local Authority Housing Stock by Normal Use
Description: Local Authority owned housing stock, by normal use of dwelling

Title: Schools - Attainment by Deprivation
Description: The average total tariff score, and percentage of school leavers by Scottish Index of Multiple Deprivation (SIMD) Quintile

Title: Schools - Attainment for All
Description: School leaver average total tariff score: grouped into the lowest 20%, middle 60% and highest 20% of attainers for each school

Title: Schools - Leaver Count
Description: The number of school leavers for each establishment, by year

Title: Schools - Positive Leaver Destinations
Description: The percentage of school leavers going to a 'positive destination' on leaving school

Title: Schools - Literacy and Numeracy
Description: The percentage of school leavers attaining literacy and numeracy at SCQF level 4 or better and SCQF level 5 or better

Title: Education establishments
Description: Reference information on schools and other types of educational establishments.

Title: Schools - Breadth and Depth of Qualifications
Description: The range of qualifications taken by school pupils and the level at which they are achieved

Title: Population Projections (2016-based)
Description: Population projections for Scotland and Scottish Areas, based on 2016 population estimates. Please see the Population Projections (2018-based) dataset for the most up-to-date projections.

Title: Children in Families with Limited Resources
Description: Percent of children in families that have both low income and cannot afford three or more out of a list of 22 basic necessities.

Title: Local Authority Housing Stock by Type
Description: Local Authority owned housing stock, by type of dwelling

Title: Household Financial Management - Scottish Household Survey
Description: How households in Scotland manage financially, from the Scottish Household Survey (SHS)

Title: Community Ownership – Area of Land
Description: Area of land in community ownership (hectares)

Title: Life Expectancy
Description: Life expectancy in years, at birth and for age groups

Title: Land and Buildings Transaction Tax Revenues
Description: Land and Buildings Transaction Tax revenues by month of submission, type of transaction, type of property and total consideration. Additional Dwelling Supplement revenue and repayments claimed by month of submission are also provided.

Title: Land and Buildings Transaction Tax Notifiable Transactions
Description: Land and Buildings Transaction Tax (LBTT) notifiable transactions by month of submission, type of transaction, type of property and total consideration. LBTT notifiable transactions in which Additional Dwelling Supplement was declared due by month of submission are also provided.

Title: Local Authority Housing Stock by Age
Description: Local Authority owned housing stock, by age of dwelling

Title: Community Ownership – Number of Community Groups
Description: Number of community groups that own assets

Title: Community Ownership – Number of Assets
Description: Number of assets in community ownership

Title: Business Enterprise Research and Development Expenditure
Description: Expenditure and employment on research and development by businesses in Scotland since 2001.

Title: Business Demography - Survival
Description: Number and rate (percent) of VAT/PAYE business survival.

Title: Dwelling Disrepair (Scottish House Condition Survey)
Description: The proportion of households with any (basic) disrepair, disrepair to critical elements, urgent disrepair or extensive disrepair to their dwelling, by dwelling types,  household characteristics and council area. Derived from the Scottish House Condition Survey (SHCS).

Title: Area improvement - Scottish Household Survey
Description: If local neighbourhood has improved over the last three years, from the Scottish Household Survey (SHS)

Title: Community belonging - Scottish Household Survey
Description: How strongly adults in Scotland feel they belong to their immediate neighbourhood, from the Scottish Household Survey (SHS)

Title: Local Authority Services and Performance - Scottish Household Survey
Description: Percentage of adults who agree with various statements about local authority services and performance, from the Scottish Household Survey (SHS)

Title: Exports by Industry
Description: Scottish international exports and Scottish exports to the rest of the UK broken down by industry sector.

Title: Local Authority Housing Lettings
Description: Lettings of local authority dwellings, by local authority

Title: Domestic Energy Performance Certificates - Dataset to Q2 2021
Description: Management Information: environmental data on the Domestic Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) and Recommendations Report for each current record held on the Scottish EPC Register from Q4 2012 to Q2 2021.  Data extracted July 2021.

Title: Non-domestic Energy Performance Certificates - Dataset to Q2 2021
Description: Management Information: environmental data on Non-domestic Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) and Recommendations Report for each current record held on the Scottish EPC Register from Q1 2013 to Q2 2021.  Data extracted July 2021.

Title: Discretionary Housing Payments Applications
Description: Number of applications received by Local Authorities for Discretionary Housing Payments

Title: Discretionary Housing Payments Determinations
Description: Number of determinations (decisions to make or not make an award) made by Local Authorities on Discretionary Housing Payments applications.

Title: Discretionary Housing Payments Awards
Description: Number of awards made by Local Authorities for Discretionary Housing Payments.

Title: Discretionary Housing Payments Expenditure
Description: Amount spent by Local Authorities on awards for Discretionary Housing Payments

Title: Educational attainment of school leavers
Description: The score is based on school leavers’ highest level of qualification, averaged across all leavers within a data zone.

Title: Gross Expenditure on Research and Development
Description: Gross Expenditure on Research and Development in Scotland since 2001.

Title: Settlements and Localities Population
Description: Mid-year population estimates for built-up areas of Scotland.

Title: Distance to Nearest Green or Blue Space (National Indicator)
Description: Percentage of adults living within 5 minutes walking distance of their nearest green or blue space

Title: Local Authority Vacant Dwellings
Description: Local authority vacant stock: as at 31 March each year, by current status and length of vacancy

Title: Local Authority Vacant Dwellings (vacancies arising during the year)
Description: Number of Local Authority dwellings falling vacant during the year and which are available for reletting (whether or not relet)

Title: Household Projections of Average Household Size
Description: 25 year projection of household size (people per household) for Council Areas, Health Board areas, and National Parks. The data given here is part of the same projection shown in Household Projections, which shows a more detailed breakdown of the projection

Title: Household Projections
Description: 25 year projection of households for Council Areas, Health Board Areas, and National Parks. The data is broken down by the household reference person age and the type of household

Title: Gender Employment Gap
Description: The difference between the employment rates for men and women (aged 16-64).

Title: Net Migration
Description: Net migration by age, sex, council area and year.

Title: Migration To and From Scotland
Description: Migration to and from Scotland by single year of age, sex and year.

Title: Self Employment
Description: Self Employment level and ratio (aged 16 and over).

Title: Labour Productivity: Annual
Description: The average amount of economic output produced per job and per hour worked in Scotland.

Title: Labour Productivity: Quarterly
Description: The average amount of economic output produced per job and per hour worked in Scotland

Title: Child Benefit - Families
Description: Geographical analysis of families claiming Child Benefit at small area levels. Number of families in a live Child Benefit award as at 31st August.

Title: Alcohol Related Hospital Statistics
Description: The alcohol-related inpatient and day case activity taking place within general acute hospitals and psychiatric hospitals in Scotland.

Title: Business Stocks and Sites by Urban Rural Classification
Description: Number of VAT/PAYE registered stocks and sites operating in Scotland by Urban Rural Classification

Title: Business Stocks and Sites by Region of Ownership
Description: Number of VAT/PAYE registered stocks and sites operating in Scotland by region of ownership

Title: Delayed Discharges - Monthly Bed Days Occupied
Description: Number of bed days occupied by hospital inpatients who are ready for discharge, but whose discharge has been delayed.

Title: Living Wage
Description: Number and percentage of employees earning less than the living wage, based on workplace local authority

Title: Underemployment
Description: People who are in work but who would prefer to work more hours for the same rate of pay

Title: Distance to Green or Blue Space - Scottish Household Survey
Description: Percentage of adults living within various walking distances to their nearest green or blue space

Title: Neighbourhood safety when walking alone - Scottish Household Survey
Description: How safe adults in Scotland feel when walking alone in their neighbourhood after dark, from the Scottish Household Survey (SHS)

Title: Feeling safe when alone at home - Scottish Household Survey
Description: How safe adults in Scotland feel when alone in their home at night, from the Scottish Household Survey (SHS)

Title: Scottish Landfill Tax
Description: Scottish Landfill Tax (SLfT) revenues and contributions to the Scottish Landfill Communities Fund by quarter. The associated waste disposals by SLfT rate, the number of SLfT returns received and the number of landfill sites covered by these returns is also provided.

Title: Involvement with people in the neighbourhood - Scottish Household Survey
Description: Percentage of adults who agree with various statements about involvement with people in their neighbourhood, from the Scottish Household Survey (SHS)

Title: Carer's Allowance Supplement
Description:
Carer’s Allowance Supplement payments- number, percentage and expenditure. 
National values are broken down by age, gender and local authority.

Title: 6-in-1 Immunisation
Description: Number and percent of children who have completed their primary immunisation course of the 6-in-1 vaccine by 24 months of age. The 6-in-1 vaccine replaced the 5-in-1 vaccine in the routine childhood immunisation schedule from 1 October 2017.

Title: Supply, Use and Input-Output Tables
Description:
Covering the period 1998-2018, these tables provide a complete picture of the flows of products in the Scottish onshore economy for a given year. 

They detail the relationship between producers and consumers and the interdependencies of industries.

Title: Data Zone Lookup
Description: Geography lookup tables used for aggregation, from 2011 data zones to higher level geographies

Title: Best Start Grant and Best Start Foods: Applications
Description: Received applications and authorised applications (awards) for Best Start Grant Pregnancy and Baby Payment,  Early Learning Payment, School Age Payment and Best Start Foods Payment

Title: Early Learning and Childcare: Services Registered
Description: Number and rate (per 10,000 people) of services registered to provide early learning and childcare

Title: Early Learning and Childcare: Children Registered
Description: Number and rate (per 100 children) of children registered to attend early learning and childcare services

Title: Community Payback Orders: Commenced
Description: Community payback orders commenced in each year from 2011-12 by age group and gender.

Title: Care Homes: Health Characteristics of Residents
Description: The number and percentage of long stay residents by various health characteristics and those requiring nursing care, for different main client groups.

Title: Care Homes: Demographic Characteristics of Residents
Description: The number and percentage of long stay residents by age and sex, for different main client groups

Title: Social Security Scotland Feedback: Complaints
Description: Feedback statistics covering complaints received by Social Security Scotland.

Title: Social Security Scotland Feedback: Complaint Outcomes
Description: Feedback statistics covering complaints received by Social Security Scotland.

Title: Social Security Scotland Feedback: Compliments
Description: Feedback statistics covering compliments received by Social Security Scotland.

Title: Care Homes: Admissions, Discharges and Deaths
Description: The number of admissions, discharges and deaths in care homes, for different main client groups.

Title: Care Homes: Average Age of Residents
Description: The mean and median age of long stay residents, as well as at the time of admission and discharge, by main client group.

Title: Care Homes: Type Of Stay
Description: The number of residents by their type of stay (long/short/respite stay) across care home sectors and for various main client groups.

Title: Care Homes: Length Of Stay
Description: The percentage of long stay care home residents by length of their stay, as well as mean and median lengths of stay

Title: Exports by Local Authority
Description: Local authority estimates of international exports, by destination

Title: Care Homes: Weekly Charges and Sources of Funding

Title: Health and Safety Incidents
Description: In the event of a Health and Safety incident arising out of, or in connection with, a work activity all employees have a duty to report the incident to their line manager as soon as practicable after the event. This dataset gives details of any incidents recorded.

Title: Train Stations (NaPTAN)
Description: The National Public Transport Access Node (NaPTAN) identifies points of access to public in Britain. Every bus stop, railway station, ferry terminal in Britain (except for Northern Ireland) has NaPTAN record. This record includes location co-ordinates, (both Ordanance Survey Grid Finder number and latitude and longitude); National Public Transport Gazetteer locality reference number; name and SMS code. For more information go to https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-public-transport-access-node-schema

Title: Free School Meals by DZ - 2017/18
OriginalTags: education;free school meals;poverty alleviating grants;north ayrshire
Description: This is the Free School Meals paid out by the Council by Datazone in 2017/18. Shown as a count in the datazone and also as a score out of 10. A Datazone is an area which has a population of around 500 to 1,000 residents.

Title: Poverty Alleviating Grants Index by DZ - 2017/18
Description: The Poverty Alleviating Grants index was created from 18 datasets that are either a poverty alleviating grants (eg Housing benefit or free school meals etc) or dataset that gives an indication of poverty such negative rent balance or benefit enquiry). Every datazone in each of the data set has been scored 1 to 10 accordingly then the datasets have been weighed by how much the council spends and how big the dataset set as an indicator of poverty. This gives a combined score out of 10 for each datazone.

Title: Housing Land Audit 2016
Description: Scottish Planning Policy ( SPP) requires that a five-year ongoing effective land supply is available to meet the identified housing land requirements. Planning authorities should therefore carry out regular monitoring of housing completions and the progress of sites through the planning process. This can be achieved through the preparation of a housing land audit, carried out annually by the planning authority in conjunction with housing and infrastructure providers.

Title: Housing Land Audit 2020
Description: Scottish Planning Policy ( SPP) requires that a five-year ongoing effective land supply is available to meet the identified housing land requirements. Planning authorities should therefore carry out regular monitoring of housing completions and the progress of sites through the planning process. This can be achieved through the preparation of a housing land audit, carried out annually by the planning authority in conjunction with housing and infrastructure providers.

Title: Homelessness - Property Type Made Homeless From
Description: This dataset is made up of answers to Question 14a of the HL1 homelessness questionnaire. Title: Homelessness - Slept Rough in Past 3 Months
Description: This dataset is made up of answers to Question 12 in the HL1 homelessness questionnaire.  Has any member of the applicant household slept outside, in the open air (such as on the streets, or in doorways, parks or bus shelters) or slept in a building or other place not designed for habitation (such as barns, sheds, car parks, cars, derelict boats, stations etc.) for at least one full night in the last 3 months.

Title: Employment Land Supply 2017
OriginalTags: planning;local development plan;employment land supply;land audit
Description: Scottish Planning Policy sets out the Scottish Governments policies in relation to economic development in Scotland. An Employment Land Audit is produced to monitor the supply, take up and status of employment land in line with National Guidance. The audit assesses the range and choice of marketable sites and locations for businesses with a variety of size and quality requirements. The audit identifies the availability and constraints of employment land sites within the local authority.
CombinedTags: planning;;employment land supply;local development plan;land audit

Title: Planning Applications
Description: Development management is the process of deciding planning applications, including the appeals and review processes. Legislation defines what development activities require planning permission and that decisions are made in keeping with the Development Plan.  Development is defined in the legislation as the carrying out of building, engineering, mining or other operations in, on, over or under land, or the making of any material change in the use of any buildings or other land. The definition also covers changes of use which may not involve physical building work.

Title: Building Warrant Applications

Title: Building Warrant Enforcement Notices
Description: It is an offence for anyone to carry out work to which the building regulations apply without a building warrant. Where the local authority’s Building Standards Service consider it necessary, a 'building warrant enforcement notice' may be served on the relevant person.

Title: LDP2 - Local Nature Reserves
OriginalTags: nac;open data;planning;local development plan;ldp2;local nature reserves
Description: LNRs  are  established  in  a  variety   of locations  with  very varied  habitats  and species.  They must lie wholly  within  the area of jurisdiction of the local authority which  declares them to be reserves.  Prior to  such  declaration, the local  authority must  own  or lease the site or  obtain  an agreement from the owner.   LNRs  are  generally smaller than NNRs  and closer  to centres of population. They  are frequently  provided for the enjoyment and education of local people whose involvement in site management is encouraged.
CombinedTags: planning;;open data;local development plan;nac;local nature reserves;ldp2

Title: Members Allowances and Expenses
Description: The Local Government (Allowance and Expenses) (Scotland) Regulations 2007 as amended, require the Council to keep a record of payments made to Members and to publish the information for the preceding financial year (1 April to 31 March) by 1 June.  Under the Local Governance (Scotland) Act 2004 (Remuneration) Regulations 2007 as amended, there are four levels of remuneration payments for Councillors, depending on the responsibilities of the Councillor. These are the Leader of the Council, Depute Leader of the Council, Senior Councillor and Councillor.   A Senior Councillor is a Councillor who holds a position of significant position of responsibility in the Council's Political Management Structure. All other Councillors, other than the Leader of the Council and the Depute Leader of the Council will receive the basic remuneration as prescribed by the Regulations. Remuneration is subject to income tax and national insurance deductions.

Title: Edinburgh World Heritage Site
Description: Polygon shapefile showing the Edinburgh World Heritage Site as of 1997.   World Heritage Sites are designated to meet the UK’s commitments under the World Heritage Convention. The UK’s ratification also extends to its Overseas Territories and Crown Dependencies. These sites are designated for their globally important cultural or natural interest and require appropriate management and protection measures.

Title: Air Quality Management Areas
Description: Locations of Air Quality Management Areas in the City of Edinburgh Council area. Since December 1997 each local authority in the UK has been carrying out a review and assessment of air quality in their area. This involves measuring air pollution and trying to predict how it will change in the next few years. The aim of the review is to make sure that the national air quality objectives will be achieved throughout the UK by the relevant deadlines. If a local authority finds any places where the objectives are not likely to be achieved, it must declare an Air Quality Management Area there. This area could be just one or two streets, or it could be much bigger.

Title: Listed Buildings OLD
Description: The Listed Building Dataset comprises the statutory addresses and supplementary information for listed buildings in Scotland. Listing is the recognition through the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) (Scotland) Act 1997 that a building or structure is of special interest. Historic Environment Scotland lists buildings on behalf of Scottish Ministers.

Title: Natural Neighbourhoods
Description: Natural neighbourhoods are neighbourhood definitions and boundaries created during a consultation with Edinburgh residents. Natural neighbourhood boundaries were created in 2004 as part of a review of ward boundaries. The city has changed much since then, the population has increased, new neighbourhoods have appeared and demolition has taken place in other areas so the 2014 consultation has updated these boundaries. The boundaries will be used by the Council and its partners to plan services, consultations and inform policy and strategy development.

Title: Neighbourhood Partnerships
Description:
Neighbourhood Partnerships are made up of councillors, public agencies, community representatives, Police, NHS Lothian and the voluntary sector. The key focus of the Partnerships is to address issues that affect local quality of life.

The Partnerships are able to make recommendations and provide guidance and direction to the Council and partner organisations. They’ll also take on decisions relating to environment, open space and traffic management; they’ll be responsible for local consultation; they’ll award small community grants for local projects, and they’ll be able to inform the development of city strategies – making sure they reflect local needs and priorities.

Title: Open Space Audit 2009
Description: The open space audit was carried out in 2009 as part of the open space strategy. The Open Space Strategy was approved by the Council's Policy and Strategy and Planning Committees at the end of September 2010.  The preparation of an open space strategy is a recent requirement of national planning policy, requiring the creation of an audit, a strategy and action plans. The implementation of the strategy and action plans will be monitored and every five years, from 2015, the strategy will be reviewed and updated.

Title: Housing Association Properties
Description: The primary data source for these tenure estimates is the Council Tax Register compiled by the City Assessor. Stores, garages and properties relating to hostels and institutions have been excluded from the total stock count. Ownership information from this source relies to a considerable extent on residents notifying the Council that a change of tenure has taken place. Accordingly, the figures contained within this file may differ slightly from other estimates available which make use of additional data sources, such as tenure data from the Housing Benefits system, a housing stock file from the Glasgow Housing Association and the Statutory Register of Private Landlords. These tenure estimates were last undertaken for housing stock as it was in 2018, with the report going to Council committee in 2019. These estimates which are aggregated to neighbourhood level are available at: https://www.glasgow.gov.uk/CHttpHandler.ashx?id=46229&p=0The ownership information from the various data sources does not always agree. This is a particular issue for private renting. For dwellings where the available evidence from the Council Tax Register and the Statutory Register of Private Landlords is not consistent, a more detailed tenure assessment was carried out, using a sample. The proportions for owner occupation and private renting from the sample have been used to estimate the tenure for dwellings where the tenure position is unclear.The owner occupied stock figures include shared ownership and shared equity properties. The social rented stock figures include mid-market rent housing. Housing at full market rent has been classified as private rented stock, irrespective of ownership.

Title: HMO Public Register
Description: Glasgow City Council's Licensing and Regulatory Committee is responsible for administering the House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) Licensing scheme for Glasgow under the Housing (Scotland) Act 2006. In terms of the Housing (Scotland) Act 2006 a licence for a House in Multiple Occupation is required for premises where there are three or more persons living together, who are not all members of either the same family or of one or other of two families.The HMO Public Register contains a list of all accommodation in Glasgow that currently have an HMO licence, or previously had a licence (from 2017 onwards), or had applied for a licence which was rejected and any pending applications for new or existing licences which are currently being processed. It is updated weekly to reflect this.The register contains the following information:Licence start and expiry datesLicence numberLicence status Application type Licence holder name and letting agent name (if applicable)Property address, ward, number of bedrooms and occupant capacity Further information is available at: https://www.glasgow.gov.uk/index.aspx?articleid=22540

It is updated weekly to reflect this.The register contains the following information:Licence start and expiry datesLicence number Licence holder name, and letting agent name (if applicable)Property address, ward, number of bedrooms and occupant capacity Further information is available at: https://www.glasgow.gov.uk/index.aspx?articleid=22540

Title: Charities Register (OSCR)
Description: The Scottish Charity Regulator (OSCR) is a Non-Ministerial Department and part of the Scottish Administration under the Charities and Trustee Investment (Scotland) Act 2005.OSCR is the independent regulator and registrar for over 24,000 Scottish charities including community groups, religious charities, schools, universities, grant-giving charities, trusts and major care providers. Their role as charity regulator is designed to ensure public confidence in charities and their work.The register maintained by OSCR is updated daily and is publicly available for free download. This file contains an extract of the register at 21 October 2021, only organisations giving Glasgow as their main area of operation are contained in the file.The data indicates the location of the head office only. Other than the declaration of Glasgow city being the main area of operation, no sub-Glasgow operational area is specified in the file.The file contains information relating to the charitable purpose, target group and income and expenditure details for the previous financial year. Access to the full extract can be found at: https://www.oscr.org.uk/about-charities/search-the-register/charity-register-download/

Title: Area Partnership Grants
Description: All 23 Area Partnerships in Glasgow are allocated an area budget each year which they use to provide grants to mainly local community and voluntary organisations, to help those organisations achieve local priorities set by each Partnership. Financial support can also be awarded to support Council Services and other partner organisations if the application demonstrates a fit with local priorities, the involvement of local people, and additional benefits.The total budget available from the 23 Area Partnerships for 2021/22 amounts to £1,864,968, with varying allocations to individual Area Partnerships. Grant applications are invited at any time, with grants under £500 awarded on a regular basis, and larger awards decided at Area Partnership meetings (normally four times per year, maximum limits apply).

Title: Road Safety Accidents
Description: This dataset captures detailed statistics about road accidents in Glasgow from 2014 to 2020. The data relate to type of accident, casualties and the vehicles involved. The statistics relate only to personal injury accidents on public roads that are reported to the police, and subsequently recorded, using the STATS19 accident reporting form. Data are released via the UK Department for Transport and can be found at the UK Government Data portal data.gov.uk.

Title: School Census Secondary 2020
Description: The “Pupils in Scotland Census” is undertaken annually and collates a wide variety of information on pupils in all publicly funded schools in Scotland. These files provide information at the level of individual schools separated into primary, secondary and additional support for learning (ASL) provision.Each file contains information on: school roll;proportion of pupils living in the 20% most deprived areas in Scotland (using the SIMD 2020 ver 2);ethnicity;the proportion of pupils for whom English is an additional language.The Pupil in Scotland census data is obtained from schools management information systems and is validated by ScotXed.

Title: Cordon Count Survey
Description:
Glasgow City Council has undertaken annual surveys since 2007 to evaluate the number of pedestrians and cyclists entering and leaving the city as part of the annual monitoring of active travel patterns. The data presented here are from 2009 onwards. A total of 35 sites form a cordon around the centre of the city and are monitored between 6:00am and 8:00pm over two successive days each September. All pedestrian and cycle movement at these locations, to and from the city, are counted.

The City Centre Cordon Count was undertaken annually between 2009 and 2018. The frequency changed to every 3 years due to the availability of the data produced by the suite of automatic cycle counters. The first count in the new schedule was programmed for 2021 however, a supplementary count was undertaken in 2020 to measure the effects of the global pandemic on active travel within the city cordon.

Title: Community Managed Facilities
OriginalTags: council glasgow life buildings community facilities council managed;community;property
Description: Locations of Major GCC and Glasgow Life Buildings, by specified type. Includes GCC Service Department HQs/main buildings, Major Glasgow Life Facilities, ALEO HQs etc e.g. Libraries, Sports Centres, Swimming Pools, Museums, etc. Selected Community Facilities - Community Halls, Youth Centres, Neighbourhood Centres - which have Glasgow Life managemanagement committment but which and operated by the Voluntary Sector. Selected Community Facilities - Community Centres, Youth Centres, Recreation Centres - managed and operated by Glasgow Life.

Title: Licensed Premises
Description: Alcohol Licences allow premises and individuals to sell alcohol. They are issued by the City of Glasgow Licensing Board. This dataset shows the location of current Premises Licences. More information and additional data such as Personal Licence, Occasional Licence, Premises Licence, Transfer of Premises Licence, Variation of Premises Licence (Major & Minor) and Premises Licence Extended Hours can be found on the Glasgow City Council website (https://www.glasgow.gov.uk/index.aspx?articleid=17552). This data is updated weekly.

More information and additional data such as Personal Licence, Occasional Licence, Premises Licence, Transfer of Premises Licence, Variation of Premises Licence (Major & Minor) and Premises Licence Extended Hours can be found on the Glasgow City Council website (https://www.glasgow.gov.uk/index.aspx?articleid=17552). This data is updated weekly.

Title: Glasgow House Sales 1991-2013
Description:
Data relating to the price of houses sold in the Glasgow Area from the years 1991 - 2013.

Some elements of the dataset are derived from information produced by Registers of Scotland

CLASS Administrative Classification only

STNO Street Number

STnu Street Number

FLATPOSN Flat Position

STNAME Street Name

POSTCODE Post Code

MONTH OF SALE Month of Sale

YEAR OF SALE (CALENDAR) YEAR OF SALE (CALENDAR)

YEAR OF SALE (BUSINESS) YEAR OF SALE (BUSINESS)

MONTH AND YEAR MONTH AND YEAR

QUARTER_(CALENDAR) QUARTER_(CALENDAR)

ACTUAL PRICE AT POINT OF SALE Actual Price

RPI Retail Price Index - Published every month and available for the last 20 years

DEFLATOR Figure used to to determine change in house prices over time - calculated fromthe Retail Price Index and other data

PRICE CONSTANT AT July 2013 Actual Price multiplied by the Deflator. This is the price if RPI is applied to original sale price - How much would the property be valued at now.

ORIGINOFBUY Council area or Country where the buyer comes from

OMIT OR USE Oroginal data also included retail and commercial data. - Not reproduced here

NEWBUILD OR RESALE Is it a newbuild house or a resale

Title: Glasgow CCTV Object Count Data
Description:
Object Count data collected from over 40 CCTV cameras owned by Glasgow City Council. Since 2019, Urban Big Data Centre at University of Glasgow, Glasgow City Council and Glasgow Centre for Population Health have been collaborating on a project to combine Data Science with the city’s existing CCTV network to generate object count data.

Selected CCTV cameras take a single frame image every 30 minutes across the 40 plus cameras and the images are processed using machine learning algorithms to detect and count various objects – the objects include person, car, bicycle, motorcycle, bus and truck. The counts of objects in the frame are collected and returned via an API created to access and query the data.

Users can query the API to return data on object type, location and time periods since November 2019.

As the data detects objects only once every 30 minutes the data cannot be used to determine the absolute number of objects (such as persons) in one place over time. Rather the data should be used to compare the difference in object counts between places at the same time or the same image frame over two or more time periods.

Note that the camera images do not store or track individual images of people, rather the algorithms are trained to recognise the outline shape of an object only and count it every time it detects the object in the image frame. One of the image count data are retained or stored after they have been counted.

Title: A&E Attendances
OriginalTags: nhs;safe data haven;health;a&e 2015-2019;glasgow city accident and emergency attendances 2015-2019
Description: Data is part of a series of data sets provided by the Data Safe Haven, NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde. This file relates to Acute visits/unplanned care visits to Glasgow City Accident and Emergency Units, covering the period 2015-2019. Geography is 2011 Intermediate Zones. Records were excluded where they contained no postcode, as this could not be matched to an IZ. (22,011 of 6,490,923 total, 0.34% for the full dataset). Year refers to calendar year.
CombinedTags: ;nhs;safe data haven;glasgow city accident and emergency attendances 2015-2019;health;a&e 2015-2019

Title: Glasgow Communities Fund
Description: Open to eligible third sector, voluntary and community organisations across Glasgow, the fund, worth more than £60million over three years, will support services and activities that improve the health, well-being, social and economic position of communities and individuals.  The data provide awards made covering the period 2020/21 to 2022/23.

Title: Fixed Penalty Notices
Description: Captures the number of Fixed Penalty Notices (FPNs) issues for littering and dog fouling - these are one of the main powers used by Community Enforcement officers to deter people from littering in public spaces. The data are aggregates of FPNs per ward and for each month. Data from 2018-2019

Title: Footfall
Description: Access to data on the volume of footfall across Glasgow City Centre, generated from a network of sensors provided by Springboard. Data by hour, day, month and year going back to 2010.

Title: App Gallery
Description: Our open data is about more than the numbers – it relates to real people, places and issues. We want to bring the data to life by sharing some stories around what it tells us about the city and how we might use these insights to improve the lives of those who live and work in Glasgow.
